summary: This document is an email chain from September 2019 between an Assistant United States Attorney (AUSA) and an unnamed individual, discussing scheduling for interviews related to the Epstein investigation. The AUSA invites the recipient to attend an interview on Tuesday and mentions another interview on Friday.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The sender of the email, inviting the recipient to attend interviews related to the Epstein investigation and providing scheduling details.

events.title: Epstein Investigation Interview
events.description: An interview relating to the Epstein investigation scheduled for 12:30 PM.

events.title: Inmate Interview for Epstein Investigation
events.description: Another interview of an inmate relating to the Epstein investigation scheduled for 12:00 PM.

locations: United States Attorney's Office Southern District of New York, One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The email confirms active investigative interviews related to the Epstein case were being conducted by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York in September 2019.
At least two specific interviews were scheduled: one on Tuesday, September 10, 2019, and another with an inmate on Friday, September 13, 2019.
The communication is between a federal prosecutor and another individual, likely a colleague or intern, being brought into the investigative process.
The document shows the routine operational planning within the prosecution team following Epstein's death in August 2019.
